note:
Name:  ___                     Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Dyspnea
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old woman ot with non small cell
lung cancer Stage 2B s/p radiation/chemo, COPD, atrial
fibrillation, hx of PE  on apixaban, recurrent pleural effusions
with prior pleurex catheter, orthostatic hypotension, CAD,
presenting with 2 weeks of worsening dyspnea on exertion.  She
currently has a left sided chest Pleurx in place, which is
drained ___.  She she denied cough, fever,
chills, headache, recent falls.  She denied abdominal pain,
nausea, vomiting, but endorse chronic constipation.

In the ED, initial vital signs were 97.0 80 117/78 18 92% on 
room
air.
Labs notable for normal CBC, BMP within normal limits, LFTs
within normal limits with a mildly elevated alk phos of 107. 
ProBNP of 2790.  UA large leuk esterase, positive nitrites,
moderate bacteria.
Exam notable for in short sentences, elevated JVD, no pedal
edema.  Per the ED, point-of-care ultrasound showed a small
pericardial effusion and a large left pleural effusion.
She received 30 mg p.o. diltiazem, IV ceftriaxone and docusate,
and 20 mg iV furosemide.

Upon arrival to the floor, the patient tells the story as
follows.  She reports that over the past 3 weeks, her dyspnea on
exertion has significantly worsened.  She reports that 
previously
should be able to walk about 10 steps prior to becoming short of
breath, however, she can only currently walk approximately 2
steps.  She reports she short of breath with any exertion.  She
has been having her Pleurx catheter drained by ___ nursing 3
times a week, with approximately 600-700 cc of fluid drained 
each
time.  She notes that even when the fluid is drained, she has no
improvement or change in her shortness of breath.  She otherwise
denies fevers, chills, cough, chest pain, palpitations,
orthopnea, shortness of breath at rest, weight gain, or lower
extremity edema.  She otherwise denies nausea, vomiting, urinary
frequency.  She notes that she has had constipation occurring
over the past few weeks.  Of note, she is on a slow prednisone
taper, currently taking 4 mg per day, and reports that she was
plan to take 3 mg per day starting tomorrow.

Pt was recently admitted ___ for SOB, thought to be due
to COPD exacerbation and need to drain TPC. She was last seen by
interventional pulmonary on ___, who noted that she is not 
a
candidate for pleuredesis given that she continues to have
significant drainage, approximately 700 cc three times per week.

ROS: Pertinent positives and negatives as noted in the HPI.  All
other systems were reviewed and are negative. 

 
Past Medical History:
- Squamous cell lung cancer 
- Prior history of pulmonary embolus on apixaban
- Coronary artery disease
- hypothyroidism
- Hypertension 
- colonic polyps
- Atrial fibrillation
- COPD
- Recurrent pleural effusions 

PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
- Presented to PCP ___ with new AF/flutter. CXR obtained at
___ ED which demonstrated a left hilar prominence. CTA 
obtained demonstrated a 4.9 cm left perihilar mass with 
extension to the mediastinum, concerning for primary lung 
malignancy.
- Admitted to ___ for further work-up. Bronchoscopy (___)
with FNA of left upper lobe showed carcinoma, favoring squamous
cell with p40 positivity and TTF1 negativity.  Lymph nodes at 
level 11, level 7, and 4L were biopsied via FNA and all 3 were
negative for malignant cells. BAL was sent for cytology, and
pathology resulted with rare atypical cells and no definitively
malignant cells. 
- CT of the C/A/P on ___, was notable for the large left
hilar mass noted above spanning from the left pulmonary artery 
to the left atrium. The mass was noted to have indirect contact
with the pericardium. It was noted to have invaded the left 
pulmonary vein with tumor thrombus noted. Her CT also showed 
some borderline ipsilateral and contralateral mediastinal and 
subcarinal lymph nodes.  Her CT abdomen showed no evidence of 
metastatic disease within the abdomen. 
- MRI of the brain (___) with no intracranial metastases. 
- PET CT on ___ showed a 5.1cm left hilar FDG avid mass and 
a
mildly FDG avid pleural based nodule adjacent to the primary 
mass
which measured 1.5 x 0.9 cm. Her clinical stage was determined 
to be between IIa and IIIa, based on whether or not the pleural 
based nodule or enlarged lymph nodes were assumed to be 
malignant. 
- Evaluated by Dr. ___ in thoracic surgery on ___. 
She
underwent PFTs on ___ which showed: FEV1: 67% pred FEV1/FVC:
75% DLCO: 49% pred 
- Day 1 Cycle 1 (___) Paclitaxel (Taxol) 50 mg/m2-
Carboplatin AUC 2 x 6 weeks with radiation
- ___ - ___: Admitted for weakness and found to have PE
and UTI. She was started on Lovenox 60mg bid and 3 days of 
ceftriaxone
- ___: C2D1 ___ 50 mg/m2- Carboplatin AUC 2.
Administered while inpatient.
 
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
3 brothers (all smokers) died of lung cancer.
Ages at diagnosis uncertain. Mother deceased at age ___ for heart
attack. 

 
Physical Exam:
ADMISSION EXAM
--------------
VITALS: 98.1 PO 98 / 64L Lying ___ RA 
GENERAL: Alert and in no apparent distress, speaking in full
sentences
EYES: Anicteric, pupils equally round
ENT: Ears and nose without visible erythema, masses, or trauma. 
Oropharynx without visible lesion, erythema or exudate
Mucous membranes moist 
CV: Heart irregular
RESP: Lungs with decreased breath sounds in the left posterior
lung field, otherwise, no crackles, no wheezes, no accessory
muscle use
GI: Abdomen soft, non-distended, non-tender to palpation
MSK: Neck supple, moves all extremities, strength grossly full
and symmetric bilaterally in all limbs
SKIN: No rashes or ulcerations noted
NEURO: Alert, face symmetric, gaze conjugate with EOMI, speech
fluent, moves all limbs
PSYCH: pleasant, appropriate affect

DISCHARGE EXAM
--------------

GENERAL: Alert and in no apparent distress, speaking in full
sentences
EYES: Anicteric, pupils equally round
ENT: Ears and nose without visible erythema, masses, or trauma. 
Oropharynx without visible lesion, erythema or exudate
Mucous membranes moist 
CV: NS1/S2, irregularly irregular
RESP: Lungs with decreased breath sounds in the left posterior
lung field, otherwise, no crackles, no wheezes, no accessory
muscle use
GI: Abdomen soft, non-distended, non-tender to palpation
MSK: Neck supple, moves all extremities, strength grossly full
and symmetric bilaterally in all limbs
SKIN: No rashes or ulcerations noted
NEURO: Alert, face symmetric, gaze conjugate with EOMI, speech
fluent, moves all limbs
PSYCH: pleasant, appropriate affect 
PSYCH: Appropriate and calm.  

 
Pertinent Results:
ADMISSION LABS
--------------
___ 05:37PM BLOOD WBC:7.8 RBC:4.95 Hgb:13.5 Hct:44.0 MCV:89
MCH:27.3 MCHC:30.7* RDW:17.8* RDWSD:57.1* Plt Ct:270
___ 05:37PM BLOOD Neuts:71.8* Lymphs:14.5* Monos:9.7 
Eos:3.1
Baso:0.4 Im ___ AbsNeut:5.62 AbsLymp:1.13* AbsMono:0.76
AbsEos:0.24 AbsBaso:0.03
___ 05:57PM BLOOD ___ PTT:29.3 ___
___ 05:37PM BLOOD Glucose:116* UreaN:16 Creat:0.9 Na:139
K:5.1 Cl:95* HCO3:30 AnGap:14
___ 05:37PM BLOOD ALT:11 AST:21 AlkPhos:107* TotBili:0.4

IMAGING
-------
CXR ___
Left pleural catheter remains in place.  Right Port-A-Cath is no
longer visualized.  Volume loss again seen in the left 
hemithorax
with superior retraction of the hilum and increased interstitial
markings which are presumably post treatment related.  No new
consolidation.  Small persistent left pleural effusion is noted. 

Right lung remains essentially clear.  
Cardiac silhouette is stable.  No acute osseous abnormalities. 

IMPRESSION:  
No definite acute cardiopulmonary process. 

CTA ___
1. No evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality. 
2. Mild interval increase of left pleural effusion with PleurX
catheter in place and unchanged in positioning from prior. 
3. Stable post treatment changes in the left lung with no
evidence of recurrence. 
4. Unchanged small pericardial effusion. 

TTE ___
The left atrium is normal in size. No atrial septal defect is
seen by 2D or color Doppler. The estimated right atrial pressure
is ___ mmHg. Left ventricular wall thickness, cavity size, and
global systolic function are normal (LVEF>65%). Regional left
ventricular wall motion is normal. There is no ventricular 
septal
defect. Right ventricular chamber size is normal with borderline
normal free wall function. The diameters of aorta at the sinus,
ascending and arch levels are normal. No aortic regurgitation is
seen. The mitral valve leaflets are structurally normal. There 
is
no mitral valve prolapse. Mild (1+) mitral regurgitation is 
seen.
Moderate to severe [3+] eccentric tricuspid regurgitation is
seen. There is moderate pulmonary artery systolic hypertension.
There is a very small pericardial effusion. There are no
echocardiographic signs of tamponade. 

IMPRESSION: Normal global left ventricular systolic function.
Low normal global right ventricular systolic function. Moderate
pulmonary hypertension. Moderate to severe tricuspid
regurgitation. Very small pericardial effusion without 2D echo
evidence of tamponade. 

Compared with the prior study (images reviewed) of ___ a
very small pericardial effusion is seen (trivial effusion was
present on prior). Definitive right ventricular pressure/volume
overload not seen on this study despite higher pulmonary
pressures.

DISCHARGE LABS
--------------
___ 06:10AM BLOOD WBC-8.6 RBC-4.32 Hgb-12.0 Hct-38.6 MCV-89 
MCH-27.8 MCHC-31.1* RDW-17.7* RDWSD-58.4* Plt ___
___ 06:10AM BLOOD Glucose-128* UreaN-10 Creat-0.8 Na-143 
K-3.9 Cl-100 HCO3-30 AnGap-13
___ 06:10AM BLOOD Calcium-9.1 Phos-3.8 Mg-1.8
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old woman ot with non small cell lung 
cancer Stage 2B s/p radiation/chemotherapy, COPD, atrial 
fibrillation, history of pulmonary embolism on apixaban, 
recurrent pleural effusions with prior pleurex catheter, 
orthostatic hypotension, CAD, presenting with two weeks of 
worsening dyspnea on exertion.

# Dyspnea on exertion
# Pleural effusion
# Non-small cell lung cancer
# COPD: Patient with worsening dyspnea on exertion, without 
orthopnea, fevers, chills, leukocytosis, or change in cough.  
Dyspnea is likely multifactorial, and includes ongoing 
compressive atelectasis with known pleural effusion with 
frequent reaccumulation, COPD, elevated right-sided pressures
prior radiation, radiation pneumonitis.  There is no current 
evidence of recurrence for non-small cell lung cancer.  Of note, 
she had a similar presentation during her admission in ___ and 
was subsequently given morphine and Ativan for air hunger,
although these do not appear to be continued most recently.  Her 
home furosemide was continued during her admission, as well as 
her prednisone for radiation pneumonitis.  PleurX drainage was 
performed three times per week.  Her home inhalers were 
continued.  She will follow up with her oncologist following 
discharge.  Her prednisone will be tapered 1 mg/week.  She will 
be on 3 mg daily until ___, then it should be decreased to 2 mg 
daily and so forth.

# Atrial fibrillation: patient had atrial fibrillation with 
rapid ventricular response while admitted and her diltiazem was 
uptitrated to 45 mg PO q6h with good rate control.  Her home 
apixaban and digoxin was continued. 

# Presyncope
# Unsteadiness on feet: had multiple episodes of presyncope, and 
is continuously unsteady when attempting to stand.  No chest 
pain or palpitations.  There was no bradycardia or arrhythmia on 
telemetry.  She needs physical therapy for deconditioning.  Her 
home midodrine and fludrocortisone was continued.

# History of pulmonary embolism: home apixaban was continued.

# History of orthostatic hypotension: She is continued on home 
fludrocortisone and  midodrine.  She was intermittently 
orthostatic during her admission.
  
# Hypothyroidism: She was continued on home levothyroxine.

# GERD: She was continued on home omeprazole.  
  
# Hyperlipidemia: She was continued on home rosuvastatin.
 
# Asymptomatic bacteriuria: urinalysis grossly positive. Patient 
denies symptoms of fevers, dysuria, urinary frequency, 
suprapubic tenderness.  She received one dose of
ceftriaxone in the ED.  Given asymptomatic bacteruria, deferred 
further antibiotic treatment.

TRANSITIONS OF CARE
-------------------
# Follow-up: She will follow up with her oncologist following 
discharge.  Her prednisone will be tapered 1 mg/week.  She will 
be on 3 mg daily until ___, then it should be decreased to 2 mg 
daily and so forth.  PleurX drainage should be performed three 
times per week

Extended Care

Atrial fibrillation 

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,

You were hospitalized for dyspnea. Your catheter was drained and 
will need to continue to drain three times per week. You were 
also noted to have a fast heart rate from your atrial 
fibrillation.  Your diltiazem dose was increased, and your heart 
rate is now better controlled.

It is important that you continue to take your medications as 
prescribed and follow up with the appointments listed below.

We wish you all the best in your recovery,
Best wishes, 
Your ___ team 
 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
